com.sap.conn.idoc

Interface IDocFactory


  • public interface IDocFactory
    Central IDoc factory interface.

      IDoc format version default.

        See Also:

      • IDOC_VERSION_3

        static final char IDOC_VERSION_3
        IDoc format version 3.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IDOC_VERSION_3_IN_QUEUE

        static final char IDOC_VERSION_3_IN_QUEUE
        IDoc format version 3 with application layer inbound queueing. Outgoing IDocs via RFC will be sent using the tRfc protocol.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.9
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IDOC_VERSION_3_IN_QUEUE_VIA_QRFC

        static final char IDOC_VERSION_3_IN_QUEUE_VIA_QRFC
        IDoc format version 3 with application and communication protocol layer inbound queueing. Outgoing IDocs via RFC will be sent using the qRfc protocol to be processed by a QIN-scheduler at the receiving SAP AS ABAP system side.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.9
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • createIDocDocument

        IDocDocument createIDocDocument(IDocRepository repository,
                                String iDocType)
                         throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException
        Creates a new IDocDocument of the specified type corresponding to the given IDoc repository.
        Parameters:
        repository - IDoc repository providing IDoc meta data.
        iDocType - the IDoc type.
        Returns:
        the created IDocDocument.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the desired IDocDocument could not be queried from the given IDoc repository.

      • createIDocSegmentIterator

        IDocSegmentIterator createIDocSegmentIterator(IDocSegment segment,
                                              IDocSegmentIterator.Type iterationType)
        Creates a segment iterator. Depending on the iteration type the iterator starts at the segment passed as value or at the first child segment.
        • Iterators of the type ITERATE_OVER_CHILDREN and ITERATE_OVER_DESCENDANTS start at the first child segment. The segment is only used as a starting point and won't be returned in the iteration process.
        • Iterators of the type ITERATE_OVER_ALL, ITERATE_OVER_ALL_OF_SAME_TYPE, ITERATE_OVER_SIBLINGS and ITERATE_OVER_SIBLINGS_OF_SAME_TYPE start at the segment passed as value. The segment will be returned in the iteration process as first element.
        Parameters:
        segment - the parent segment or the first segment of the iterator.
        iterationType - the type that determines on how to iterate over the segments. Possible types:
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_CHILDREN
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_DESCENDANTS
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_ALL
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_ALL_OF_SAME_TYPE
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_SIBLINGS
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_SIBLINGS_OF_SAME_TYPE
        Returns:
        the created segment iterator.

      • createIDocSegmentIterator

        IDocSegmentIterator createIDocSegmentIterator(IDocSegment parentSegment,
                                              IDocSegmentIterator.Type iterationType,
                                              String segmentType)
        Creates a segment iterator.
        Parameters:
        parentSegment - the parent segment of the iterator. This segment is only used as a starting point and won't be returned in the iteration process.
        iterationType - the type that determines on how to iterate over the segments. Possible types:
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_CHILDREN
        • IDocSegmentIterator.Type.ITERATE_OVER_DESCENDANTS
        segmentType - the segment type to be considered in the iteration process. Only segments of this type will be returned in the iteration process.
        Returns:
        the created segment iterator.

        String getVersion()
        Returns the version of the SAP Java IDoc Library.

      • addTraceListener

        void addTraceListener(IDocTraceListener listener)
        Adds a trace listener for receiving all trace messages from the IDocLibrary.
        Parameters:
        listener - an IDocTraceListener instance to be added to the trace listener list.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.4

      • removeTraceListener

        void removeTraceListener(IDocTraceListener listener)
        Removes the given trace listener from the list of IDocTraceListeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - the IDocTraceListener instance to be removed from the trace listener list.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.4

      • setTrace

        void setTrace(int level,
              String path)
        Turns on the IDocLibrary trace. Allowed trace levels are in the range of [0..10]. The most commonly used are:
        • 0 - off / do not trace
        • 1 - trace errors
        • 2 - trace errors and warnings
        • 3 - trace info messages, errors and warnings
        • 4 - trace execution path, info messages, errors and warnings
        • 5 - trace full execution path, info messages, errors and warnings
        • 6 - trace full execution path, verbose info messages, errors and warnings
        • 7 - trace debug messages, full execution path, verbose info messages, errors and warnings
        • 8 - trace verbose debug messages, full execution path, verbose info messages, errors and warnings
        null, stdout, stderr or an existing path are allowed to be specified for the path value.
        If path is null, stdout or stderr the IDocLibrary will trace to the standard output or standard error stream, respectively. If at least one IDocTraceListener instance has been added, then the trace messages will be sent to the trace listeners instead of writing to the standard output or error streams.
        In order to write the IDocLibrary trace into a file, the path value must be set to an existing directory whereas the dot ('.') can be used for the Java process' current working directory. If the specified directory does not exist it will not be created and no trace file will be written in this case. Furthermore the currently running Java process must have write permission to the specified directory at the operating system's file system level, otherwise an IDocLibrary trace file can not be created either.
        Parameters:
        level - trace level [0..10].
        path - null, stdout, stderr or an existing path.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.4

      • getRepositoryIDs

        List<String> getRepositoryIDs()
        Returns a list containing the IDs of all available repository instances.
        Returns:
        the list of available repository IDs.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.7

      • getRepository

        IDocRepository getRepository(String repositoryID)
                      throws IDocRuntimeException
        Returns the repository instance for the specified repository ID.
        Parameters:
        repositoryID - ID of the requested repository.
        Returns:
        the requested repository instance or null, if no repository with the given ID exists.
        Throws:
        IDocRuntimeException - if an internal exception occurs, e.g. the repositoryID is null.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.7
